title: Very nice!
comment: I just built a brand new HTPC (linux, everything is linux in my house) and had hoped to make use of the Spotify Connect feature but quickly learned it's not yet implemented in the Linux client. This solves that problem! The dameon installs easily, adds itself to startup, and just plain works. I've only had a few hours using the Android controller but so far so good. I used to be SQA so I notice issues with a quickness and thus far I am happy. I'm sure I'll find some usability gripes soon enough, but that goes for any software ;)
Thanks! These are words that inspire me to develop free and open source applications. I hope you can consider donating a small amount of money. You can do it easily in the app.

title: This is awesome.
comment: This is a brilliant workaround for the sloppy Linux support Spotify gives us. The app works like in should, flawless and quick. Just one question: will you be able to put in a scrollbar to scroll down the track? That would be so awesome! I'll see if I can donate some to you in a few days. :)

Thanks! If you by scrollbar mean seeking in the currently playing song, it is not possible through D-Bus, unfortunately. It is out of my control. If Spotify enabled it in D-Bus I would implement it immediately.

title: Cool!
comment: Cool app! Hw acceleration is not supported on some devices. It can be changed in the settings though. I'm happy.

This is a known bug on some Samsung devices. To fix it, disable accelerated animations by going to settings in the list of computers. Uncheck the Accelerated animations checkbox. Like this: http://i.imgur.com/vfhX4Kz.jpg

title: Works perfectly!
